name.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - US Core - Capabilities - Options- XML

description.value: US Core Capabilities using HTTP OPTIONS; resource format XML; validate the FHIR server returns a valid CapabilityStatement resource containing the SMART on FHIR security endpoint discovery extensions to enable the OAuth 2.0 process.

Test capabilities operation against a server using GET metadata. The expected response content is the found CapabilityStatement resource in XML format containing the SMART on FHIR security extensions.
Test capabilities operation using HTTP OPTIONS with expected response format of XML. Test basic operation conformance and return of the SMART on FHIR security extensions.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is CapabilityStatement.
Confirm that the returned CapabilityStatement conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned CapabilityStatement resource minimally contains the declaration of security with the SMART-on-FHIR extension with an authorize extension.
Confirm that the returned CapabilityStatement resource minimally contains the declaration of security with the SMART-on-FHIR extension with an token extension.
Confirm that the returned CapabilityStatement resource minimally contains the declaration of service with a coding that contains the SMART-on-FHIR setting.
